Package io.github.ai4ci.functions

Interface MathematicalFunction

All Superinterfaces:
Serializable, SimpleFunction
@Immutable public interface MathematicalFunction extends Serializable, SimpleFunction
A mathematical function that can be evaluated at runtime. This is used to represent functions that are defined by the user as part of the configuration of the model, such as the viral load to transmission probability mapping.

The function is defined by a String expression containing `x` as the parameter, which is parsed and evaluated using the mXparser library. The parsed expression is derived from the original String and is not serialized, ensuring that only the user-defined expression is stored in the configuration.

See Also:
  • OutbreakBaseline.transmissibilityFromViralLoad(double, double)

  • Method Details

    • differential

      default double differential(double x)
      Compute the differential of the empirical function at a given X value.

      This method computes the differential of the empirical function at a given X by applying the chain rule to the interpolated value and its derivative. It uses the derivative of the link function and the derivative of the interpolator to compute the overall differential at the specified X.

      Specified by:
      differential in interface SimpleFunction
      Parameters:
      x - the X value at which to compute the differential of the empirical function
      Returns:
      the differential of the empirical function at the specified X

    • getFXExpression

      String getFXExpression()
      A univariate mathematical function as a String containing `x` as the parameter and returning a value of y on the link scale. Supported expressions are described here: https://mathparser.org/mxparser-math-collection
      Returns:
      the function expression on the link scale.

    • getInterpolationType

      @Default default Interpolators getInterpolationType()
      The interpolation method used to interpolate between the (x,y) coordinates.
      Returns:
      the interpolation method used to interpolate between the (x,y) coordinates

    • getInterpolator

      @Derived default Interpolator getInterpolator()
      The interpolator created from the coordinates and interpolation type.

      This method constructs an interpolator based on the (x,y) coordinates and the specified interpolation type. It applies the link function to the Y coordinates before interpolation. The resulting interpolator can be used to compute interpolated values for any X within the range of the coordinates.

      Returns:
      the interpolator created from the coordinates and interpolation type

    • getLink

      @Default default LinkFunction getLink()
      A link function used to transform the Y coordinates after evaluation.
      Returns:
      the link function used to transform the Y coordinates

    • value

      default double value(double x)
      Evaluate the interpolated mathematical expression at a given X value.

      This method computes the value of the expression at a given X by interpolating the Y values at the coordinates and then applying the inverse link function to the interpolated value. The result is the value of the mathematical function at the specified X.

      Specified by:
      value in interface SimpleFunction
      Parameters:
      x - the X value at which to evaluate the expression
      Returns:
      the approximate value of the expression at the specified X
